tit.e: Saiho Shochishi (which was written as 採訪処置使 and was an investigating commissioner.)
tit.cmt: 定訳不明（公開文献上にも定訳みつからず）
カッコ内を修正しました。

sen.j: 採訪処置使（さいほうしょちし）は、中国・唐代の官名である。
sen.e: Saiho Shochishi (an investigating commissioner) was a government official title which was created in Tang China.
Saiho Shochishi (an investigating commissioner) was a title of the government official in Tang dynasty of China.
sen.cmt: government official title→title pf the government official,which was created を削除しました。Tang dynasty of を挿入しました。
sen.e: Saiho Shochishi (an investigating commissioner) was a title of the government official in Tang dynasty of China.

sen.j: 開元20年（733年）に、それまで10道に区分されていた唐朝治下の諸地方を、15道に区分し直し、各道に採訪処置使を設置した。
sen.e: In 733, the empire under the Tang dynasty, which had previously been divided into ten administrative regions called 'dao or tao' circuits of inspection, was redivided into 15 dao circuits, each of which had a 'saiho shochishi' (which was written as 採訪処置使 and was an investigating commissioner) stationed therein.
sen.cmt: 「10道 (行政区画)唐」とありますが、この最後の「（行政区画）唐」はリンク先が表示されたものでしたので、修正しました（但し、補足説明として「行政区画」の訳語を使用しています）。'do or dao circuit' http://www.weblio.jp/content/道_(行政区画)#.E5.94.90 http://books.google.com/books?id=XSkbHeXWLUwC&pg=PA494&dq=kaiyuan+dao+circuit&lr=&as_brr=0&hl=ja&cd=4#v=onepage&q=kaiyuan%20dao%2C%20circuit&f=false
sen.e: In 733, the empire under the Tang dynasty, which had previously been divided into 10 administrative regions called 'dao' circuits of inspection, was redivided into 15 dao circuits, each of which had a 'saiho shochishi' stationed.
sen.cmt: ten→10,dao or tao→dao と修正しました。（dao をウェブ上で確認しました）カッコ部分、therein を削除し
sen.e: In 733, the empire under the Tang dynasty, which had previously been divided into 10 administrative regions called 'dao' circuits of inspection, was redivided into 15 dao circuits, each of which had a 'saiho shochishi' stationed.

sen.j: それ以前、中宗 (唐)代に10道に分割した時には、巡察使 (中国)が置かれていた。
sen.e: Prior to the redividing of circuits in 733, at the time of ten circuits under the middle Song (Tang) dynasty, 'junsatsushi' (which was written as 巡察使 and was a circuit-riding inspector or investigating commissioner) was stationed in each circuit.

Prior to the redividing of the circuits in 733, when 10 circuits were divided in the reign of the Emperor Jungjong (Tang), 'junsatsushi' (a circuit-riding inspector or investigating commissioner) had been stationed in each circuit.
sen.cmt: ten→10,middle Song→Jungjong,カッコ内を修正しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Prior to the redividing of the circuits in 733, when 10 circuits were divided in the reign of the Emperor Jungjong (Tang), 'junsatsushi' (a circuit-riding inspector or investigating commissioner) had been stationed in each circuit.

sen.j: その職掌は、漢代の州刺史に相当する。
sen.e: The official duties of saiho shochishi (investigating commissioners) corresponded to those of 'shu shishi' (which was written as 州刺史 and were provincial governors) in the Hang dynasty.
The official duties of saiho shochishi corresponded to those of 'shu shishi' (provincial governors) in the Han dynasty.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。(investigating commissioners) を削除しました。（既存のため）Hang→Han と修正しました。
sen.e: The official duties of saiho shochishi corresponded to those of 'shu shishi' (provincial governors) in the Han dynasty.

sen.j: よって、京畿道採訪使は、漢の司隷校尉に当たる。
sen.e: Accordingly, a 'keikido saihoshi' (which was written as 京畿道採訪使 and literally meant a Jingji circuit investigating commissioner) corresponded to a colonel director of retainers which was called 'Sili xiaowei' (which was written as 司隷校尉) in the Hang dynasty.

Accordingly, a 'keikido saihoshi' (a Jingji circuit investigating commissioner) corresponded to a colonel director of retainers which was called 'Sili xiaowei' (garrison the capital of the Executive) in the Han dynasty.
sen.cmt: それぞれのカッコ内を修正しました。Hang→Han と修正しました。
sen.e: Accordingly, a 'keikido saihoshi' (a Jingji circuit investigating commissioner) corresponded to a colonel director of retainers which was called 'Sili xiaowei' (garrison the capital of the Executive) in the Han dynasty.

sen.j: その治所は、管轄下の州の中で、最重要の州に設置された。
sen.e: Each saiho shochishi (investigating commissioner) was stationed in a province of the greatest importance among all the provinces within his jurisdiction.
Each saiho shochishi was stationed in the most important province among all the provinces within his jurisdiction.
sen.cmt: (investigating commissioner) を削除しました。a province of the greatest importance→the most important province と修正しました。
sen.e: Each saiho shochishi was stationed in the most important province among all the provinces within his jurisdiction.

sen.j: その後、その職掌は、次第に民政に重点が置かれるようになった。
sen.e: Later, the major official duties of saiho shochishi (investigating commissioners) began to shift gradually to civil administration.
Later, the official duties of saiho shochishi began to shift gradually to civil administration.
sen.cmt: major,(investigating commissioners) を削除しました。
sen.e: Later, the official duties of saiho shochishi began to shift gradually to civil administration.

sen.j: 粛宗 (唐)代以降、名称が観察使と改められ、また、天下は40余道に分割された。
sen.e: During the reign of Tang Emperor Suzong, the 'saiho shochishi' was renamed as 'kansatsushi' (which was written as 観察使 and was an imperial inspector), and the empire was divided into 40 or more dao circuits.
During and after the reign of the Emperor Suzong (Tang), the 'saiho shochishi' was renamed as 'kansatsushi' (an imperial inspector), and the empire was divided into 40 or more dao circuits.
sen.cmt: and after を挿入し、Tang Emperor Suzong→the Emperor Suzong (Tang),カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: During and after the reign of the Emperor Suzong (Tang), the 'saiho shochishi' was renamed as 'kansatsushi' (an imperial inspector), and the empire was divided into 40 or more dao circuits.

sen.j: よって、領域の広大な道では10州余り、狭いところでも2・3州を管轄とした。
sen.e: Accordingly, the jurisdiction of each inspector extended over more than 10 provinces in the case of a large circuit, and two or three provinces in the case of a small circuit.
Accordingly, the jurisdiction of each inspector extended over more than 10 provinces in the case of a large circuit, and 2 or 3 provinces in the case of a small circuit.
Accordingly, the jurisdiction of each inspector extended over more than 10 provinces in the case of a large circuit, and 2 or 3 provinces in the case of a small circuit.

sen.j: また、観察使より大なるものが節度使となるが、本来の節度使は武官であるため、文官としての観察使を兼務することとなった。
sen.e: Setsudoshi' (which was written as 節度使 and was a military commissioner in charge of a dao circuit) exercised greater power than 'kansatsushi' (imperial inspector), being a military officer by nature which was assigned the duties of a civil servant 'kansatsushi' (imperial inspector).

Setsudoshi' (a military commissioner in charge of a dao circuit) exercised greater power than 'kansatsushi' (imperial inspector), being a military officer by nature who was assigned the additional civilian post of 'kansatsushi' (imperial inspector).
sen.cmt: クォーツを修正しました。カッコ内を修正しました。the duties of a civil servant 'kansatsushi' (imperial inspector) 部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Setsudoshi' (a military commissioner in charge of a dao circuit) exercised greater power than 'kansatsushi' (imperial inspector), being a military officer by nature who was assigned the additional civilian post of 'kansatsushi' (imperial inspector).
